testing-your-first-application.title: Testing Your First Application
testing-your-first-application.description: How to test your first application with Cypress.
learnFeatures: How to write Cypress E2E tests
How to create custom Cypress commands

lessons.title: App Install and Overview
lessons.description: How to install the course application and get it up and running.

lessons.title: Installing Cypress and writing your first test
lessons.description: How to install Cypress and write your first end to end test.

lessons.title: How to test forms and custom Cypress commands
lessons.description: How to test forms and create custom Cypress commands.

lessons.title: How to test multiple pages
lessons.description: How to test multiple pages

lessons.title: How to test user journeys
lessons.description: Learn what user journey's are and how to write tests for them.

testing-foundations.title: Testing Foundations
testing-foundations.description: The fundamentals and testing basics you need to write great tests.
learnFeatures: Learn what to test and why
The Difference between Unit, Integration and E2E tests

lessons.title: Testing is a Mindset
lessons.description: Understand the testing mindset that is necessary before you begin writing tests.

challenges.question: Even if you have a QA team, their input is not necessary for automated tests?

lessons.title: Identifying What to Test
lessons.description: How to test user journeys, new features and bugs within your application.

challenges.question: What is the best way to test the most critical pieces of your application?

lessons.title: Manual vs Automated Testing
lessons.description: The differences between automated testing and manual testing.

challenges.question: Modern software development teams are integrating testing earlier in the software development lifecycle?

lessons.title: Who should be responsible for testing?
lessons.description: To ship reliable software, testing should be everyone's responsibility and involve the entire team at the start of a project.

challenges.question: Testing is everyone's responsibility

lessons.title: The Testing Pyramid
lessons.description: The difference between unit, integration and end to end tests.

challenges.question: When writing a unit test to test a function, you are primarily concerned with testing the inner logic of that function?

cypress-fundamentals.title: Cypress Fundamentals
cypress-fundamentals.description: The fundamentals of Cypress you must know.
learnFeatures: How to chain methods and assertions together

lessons.title: How to Write a Test
lessons.description: How to write tests using the Arrange, Act and Assert pattern.

challenges.question: What is a good pattern for writing tests?

lessons.title: Cypress Runs Tests in the Browser
lessons.description: Cypress's architecture runs inside of the browser. This means that your tests are being executed in the same environment as your application.

challenges.question: If it runs in the browser, Cypress has access to it?

lessons.title: Command Chaining
lessons.description: It's important to understand the mechanism Cypress uses to chain commands together. This lesson will teach you how.

challenges.question: What does Cypress yield to the next command in the chain?

lessons.title: The Asynchronous Nature of Cypress
lessons.description: How Cypress handles things asynchronously is often misunderstood by developers and can lead to issues later on. Find out more in this lesson.

challenges.question: Cypress commands return their subjects?

lessons.title: Waiting and Retry-ability
lessons.description: Cypress will automatically wait until an element becomes visible, becomes enabled, or when another element is no longer covering an element.

challenges.question: Cypress will automatically wait until an element becomes visible, becomes enabled, or when another element is no longer covering an element.

lessons.title: How to Debug Failing Tests
lessons.description: Best practices and tips on how to debug failing tests.

challenges.question: The Cypress Test Runner, ie the UI, will automatically take screenshots and videos of failing tests.

lessons.title: Cypress is just JavaScript
lessons.description: Cypress is just JavaScript which means you can leverage 3rd party libraries and other language features within your tests.

challenges.question: Using lots of variables in your tests is a good idea since Cypress is just JavaScript.

advanced-cypress-concepts.title: Advanced Cypress Testing Concepts
advanced-cypress-concepts.description: Some of the more advanced Cypress testing concepts that take your tests to the next level.

lessons.title: Database Initialization and Seeding
lessons.description: Similar to how you need a testing strategy to determine what to test, you need a data strategy for how to work with testing data.

challenges.question: The best way to create the data you need for your tests is via the UI.

lessons.title: Running in Continuous Integration (CI)
lessons.description: How to run your Cypress tests in your favorite Continuous Integration providers.

challenges.question: Cypress Cloud provides automatic parallelization and load balancing for your tests.

lessons.title: Intercepting HTTP Requests
lessons.description: In this lesson you will learn how to use cy.intercept() to manipulate and test network http requests and responses.

challenges.question: How would you wait on the following alias cy.intercept('POST', '/users').as('signup');

lessons.title: API and Integration Tests
lessons.description: How to use Cypress for your API and integration tests.

challenges.question: Cypress provides a great developer experience for testing API's

lessons.title: Building Custom Commands
lessons.description: Best practices and methods for writing Cypress custom commands.

challenges.question: You should be thinking in abstractions before you begin writing your tests

lessons.title: Viewport and Browser Testing
lessons.description: How to run your Cypress tests in different browsers and various viewports.

challenges.question: Which browser can Cypress test?

lessons.title: Cypress Methods You Need to Know
lessons.description: Some of the most useful Cypress testing methods available that few people know about.

challenges.question: Which Cypress method gets a property's value on the previously yielded subject.

lessons.title: Using Data for Dynamic Tests
lessons.description: How to use real data to drive your dynamic tests.

challenges.question: It is best to use hard-coded data for your tests.
